intro: Becium obovatum var. galpinii, commonly known as the Galpin's becium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive obovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
